channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trolleys find a new home, 26th February
item.description:
Trolleys are more comfortable on grass, less stress on the wheels. Plus a another brand trolley has taken its place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light has been out for some time now opposite the junction with Tamar Road along with all the street lights on Tamar road., 26th February
item.description:
Street light opposite junction of Tamar road on Clyde Cescent has not been working for a considerable amount of time, along with all the Street lights on Tamar Road. Pitch black and very dangerous along with the current state of the pavements and potholes in the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Clyde Crescent, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Road drain completely blocked, 26th February
item.description:
Road drain is blocked full with mud. Historically, this is an area prone to flooding resulting from sudden downpours. This adds to the significance of this drain blockage. The drain has been blocked for over two weeks and even after light rain the roadside accumulates a significant amount of standing water.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Greenway Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light STILL out!, 26th February
item.description:
This problem has been reported repeatedly and it is still yet to be fixed, the streetlight next to the garages in Selkirk close is broken and never turns on. This leaves the road very very dark. the road is used as through road for walkers including school children its very unsafe for it to be left so dark for so long.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7-12, Selkirk Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping West end carpark, 26th February
item.description:
Massive pile of bin bags in West End carpark just off lower High St. regular occurrence here. Is the shop paying for enough bins/ collections? Is there adequate bin storage for the flats above the shop?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Poole Way, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
